DataElement.preferredDefinition: the assessment of a patient's/participant's postmenopausal status as defined by the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the assessment of postmenopause, in a woman's life when menstrual periods stop permanently, for a patient/participant.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Refers to the time after menopause. Menopause is the time in a woman's life when menstrual periods stop permanently; also called "change of life.":Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the postmenopausal status of a patient/participant.

PermissibleValues.value: No spontaneous menses < 1 year, with FSH and estradiol levels in postmenopausal range, according to local institutional standards

PermissibleValues.value: No spontaneous menses > 1 year, not related to hormone replacement therapy (HRT)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No spontaneous menses > 1 year, not related to hormone replacement therapy (HRT)

PermissibleValues.value: History of a hysterectomy and age >55

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No value exists.: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body (partial hysterectomy) or the uterine body and cervix (total hysterectomy).

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body (partial hysterectomy) or the uterine body and cervix (total hysterectomy).

PermissibleValues.value: The absence of menstrual cycles for the 12 months preceding cancer diagnosis
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Absence of Signs or Symptoms Menstrual Cycle 12 Months or Longer Prior Cancer Diagnosis

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Absence of Signs or Symptoms Menstrual Cycle 12 Months or Longer Prior Cancer Diagnosis
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Absence of detectable signs or symptoms.: The Menstrual Cycle involves regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days. (NCI): No Value Exists: Earlier in time or order.: General term for detecting and classifying cancer in patients.

Concepts.definition: Absence of detectable signs or symptoms.

The Menstrual Cycle involves regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days. (NCI)
General term for detecting and classifying cancer in patients.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.
